bibl.title: Callimachus' Lock of Berenice: Fantasy, Romance, and Propaganda.
bibl.note: The court environment in which the Lock was written. The poem was composed as part of a program of imagery reflecting the concerns of Berenice II. The court of the queen created through art, literature, and cult a public image of her royal marriage that had a special appeal to feminine tastes.
